intro: Brassaia sprucei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its foliage is thick and velvety, often displaying shades of green, silver, or variegated patterns. Brassaia sprucei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
